body.p: The main changes from the 2010 ED are:

li.p: The amendments do not specify where in profit or loss an entity should present the net interest component. The 2010 ED proposed that an entity should include the net interest component as part of finance cost in profit or loss.
The amendments require gains and losses on settlement to be included in service cost. The 2010 ED proposed that gains and losses on settlement should be included in remeasurements.
The amendments do not require the following disclosures proposed in the 2010 ED:
the defined benefit obligation, excluding projected growth in salaries;
sensitivity of current service cost to changes in actuarial assumptions; and
a description of the process used to determine the demographic actuarial assumptions.

The amendments align the timing of recognition for plan amendments, termination benefits and restructuring costs. The 2010 ED proposed aligning the timing of recognition for plan amendments and termination benefits only.
combine the post‑employment and other long‑term employee benefit categories, as had been proposed in the 2010 ED.

state whether expected future salary increases should be included in determining whether a benefit formula allocates a materially higher level of benefit to later years, as had been proposed in the 2010 ED.
incorporate IFRIC 14 IAS 19—The Limit on a Defined Benefit Asset, Minimum Funding Requirements and their Interaction as had been proposed in the 2010 ED.
